Title: Group Services Relocation project for The Manchester College
Description: The College's Group Services, consisting of Finance, Human Resources, IT Services, Health and Safety, Marketing and Communications, Apprenticeships, MOL, Novus and Student Records /MIS are currently located within rented office space. The lease for the rented office space is coming to an end and the College are therefore preparing to relocate the above departments within the existing Wythenshawe and Openshaw Campuses. The lease for the existing accommodation has already been extended to the end February 2018 and it is therefore imperative to the College that the proposed refurbishment and remodelling works are completed by the dates stated.

Title: TENDER FOR THE SUPPLY OF TRAVEL MANAGEMENT SERVICES
Description:
The LTE Group is faced with circumstances of urgency which render impracticable the time limit laid down in relation to an open procedure by Regulation 27(5) of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015, and which would ordinarily apply to such a procedure. Therefore LTE Group need to publish this Tender opportunity under the Accelerated Open Procedure for The Supply of Travel Management Services 2019.

The LTE Group intends to arrange a Contract Agreement with an appropriate supplier for The Supply of Public Sector Travel & Venue Solutions, including but not limited to: 

Public Sector Travel Management Services:

TRAVEL MANAGEMENT SCOPE
ITEM 1	Online Booking and System Requirements
ITEM 2	Offline Booking and Offline Services
ITEM 3	Airline Bookings - Online & Offline
ITEM 4	Rail Booking - Online & Offline
ITEM 5	Accommodation Booking - Online & Offline
ITEM 6	Group Bookings - Offline Only
ITEM 7	Conference and Events Management
ITEM 8	Management, Booking & Payment Of Guest Speakers 
ITEM 9	Taxi & Private Hire Service (Hackney Cabs & PHV's Or Mini Cabs)
ITEM 10 Lease Vehicles or Hire Vehicles (Including Mini Buses)

The successful supplier securing a position on this Contract Agreement will be able to provide services from their own banks of provision or from third party service providers but in all instances the orders will be placed with, invoiced by, and managed by, the Awarded Contract Holder named on the LTE Group Contract or their nominated distributor with the express permission of LTE Group. The Contract Agreement will require a combination of day to day servicing with low value orders as well as small, medium and high value travel demand and project work. 

The LTE Group anticipates that the Contract Agreement will be with fit for purpose Service providers who will offer considerable "Added Value" benefits through a strategic alliance with all operating divisions of the LTE Group. All operating divisions of the LTE Group have a demanding infrastructure/environment and the extensive Travel Management requirement will be utilised for a variety of environments, including but not limited to Further and Higher Education, Training, Office, Hospitality, Conferencing, Events,  The Justice Sector i.e. Prisons, Custodial Establishments and Other miscellaneous settings.
Additional Text:
Tender submissions must be returned via the Proactis Contract Tendering Portal. If you have any issues in using the Proactis Tendering Portal please Telephone Proactis 0330 0050352.

Where Suppliers have any queries about the Tender documentation which may have a bearing on the offer to be made, these should be via the Proactis Tender Portal. Where any such enquiry has been made, the LTE Group will anonymise and circulate to all Suppliers a copy of the enquiry and the written reply, anonymity will be preserved, unless it is deemed they are of a strictly confidential nature. No Email or Telephone Clarifications will be allowed. 

Tender submissions must reach the LTE Group via the Proactis Tendering Portal by 12.00 noon 15th April 2019. Late Tender bids will not be considered.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb:
[CAPITA TRAVEL AND EVENTS LIMITED|Meridian Court
DE21 6BF
GB|COMPANIES_HOUSE|01094729|No|No]
Accelerated Justification: The LTE Group is faced with circumstances of urgency which render impracticable the time limit laid down in relation to an open procedure by Regulation 27(5) of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015, and which would ordinarily apply to such a procedure. Therefore LTE Group need to publish this Tender opportunity under the Accelerated Open Procedure for The Supply of Travel Management Services 2019.

Title: TENDER FOR THE PROVISION OF ENVIRONMENTAL BRANDING SERVICES FOR LTE GROUP
Description:
The purpose of this Tender Arrangement is to secure an arrangement with the LTE Group for Environmental Branding Services, with an experienced Provider to deliver the best possible arrangement in conjunction with exceptional service provision and demonstrable value for the LTE Group.

The Provider will be instrumental in delivering a cost-effective, reliable and flexible large format printing and installation provision with national reach and the capability to deliver quality products and service at pace to achieve LTE Group's stakeholder objectives.

The successful Provider will work reliably, flexibly and in collaboration with LTE Group and its organisations to produce the required signage orders precisely, as specified, within the pre-stipulated timeframes using quality, durable materials as agreed, and with all printing undertaken to an accurate and high-quality standard.
With the successive growth of the organisational structure that is LTE Group, the previous years have seen a steadily increasing demand for a dedicated professional, environmental branding and signage provider to support our in-house team and businesses.

Whilst our group's in-house marketing teams provide the itemised artwork for the development of projects and campaigns, briefs and budgets, the environmental branding provider will have the technical expertise, capability, and organisational integrity to realise the vision to maximise the return on investment.

Below are a few examples of how we will utilise the supplier to fulfil signage orders on an ongoing basis:

•	Graduation event

•	Open Day/Evening events

•	Campus branding

•	External stands for events

•	Awards Dinners

•	Conferences

•	External meetings

•	Staff and student events

Aplication to this tender and all communication regarding this tender will be managed via the ProContract procurement portal.

To apply to this opportunity please follow the link below:

https://procontract.due-north.com/Advert/Index?advertId=ccd5ec1c-486b-e911-80f7-005056b64545

Title: OPEN PROCEDURE FOR PROVISION OF AN EXTERNAL AUDIT SERVICE - Auditing services - 79212000
Description:
The primary role of External Audit Service Provider is to report on the financial statements of The LTE Group and to carry out whatever examination of the statements, and the underlying records and control systems, is necessary to reach their opinion on the statements. External Audit Service Providers reports should also state whether, in all material respects, recurrent and specific grants from HEFCE (and other bodies and restricted funds where appropriate) have been properly applied for the purposes provided, and in accordance with the institution's Financial Memorandum with HEFCE; in other words, that the conditions of grant have been met.

Auditing services - 79212000
Contact Address 2: Whitworth House, Ashton Old Road, Openshaw

The tender documents are accessible electronically, at https://procontract.due-north.com  The documents must be downloaded, completed, and re-uploaded to the tender portal, together with all other documents specified in the tender document, by noon, on 03 February 2017.

Title: TC915 MyFuture ILM Programme (Contract)
Description:
This is an award notice - MyFuture ILM Programme 

Manchester City Council will be seeking tender submissions to deliver an Intermediate Labour Market (ILM) service, 'MyFuture' for unemployed people aged 16-24 who need support to become apprenticeship ready. The service will provide work placements to develop the skills, knowledge and experience young people need to compete in the labour market. Placements will be with public, private and third sector employers and should lead to offers of apprenticeships or jobs with training for Manchester's young residents.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [The Manchester College|M40 5BP|NONE||No|No]

Title: Delivery of Education & Vocational training services activity funded through the European Social Fund to support employees and employers in Greater Manchester Local Enterprise Partnership (LEP) area.
Description:
Delivery of Education & Vocational training services activity funded through the European Social Fund (ESF) to support employees and employers in the Greater Manchester Local Enterprise Partnership (LEP) area  
The activity to be procured is: 
• Higher Skills Support for unemployed and economically inactive individuals
Contact Address 1: Skills Funding Agency , Cheylesmore House South
Attachments: Summary_of_Changes_-_V2_2_FINAL.pdf Sub-Contractor Pro-forma 2.1 16-17.docx ESF Contract for Services 15-16Final Jan 2016.pdf ESF_2014_20_funding_rates_and_formula_1516 FINAL.pdf ESF Specifications Deliverables Version 1_7 v21.pdf Amendment to Read Me First attached to the ITT.docx Deliverable toolkit Gt Manchester 15-901.pdf Greater Manchester Contract Notice.pdf European_Social_Fund_Funding_Rates_and_Formula_2015_to_2016_-_November_2015.pdf Read Me First_Current Single Theme.pdf Gt Manchester Higher Skills for Unemployed S.docx ESF_2014-20_Funding_Rules_Version_1_-_November_2015.pdf
Additional Text:
It should be noted that the SFA uses its own e-tendering portal provided as a managed service and that is the only means through which responses to this ITT will be allowed

Only organisations on the SFA Register of Training Organisations as at September 2015 or the subsequent Register publications as at February or April 2016 will be invited to this tender .

They also must have passed the Capability and Capacity stage of their Register application for delivery of education and training and  indicated in their submission  that they were interested in delivering in this LEP area  and were interested in delivering the following options:
•         16-18 Apprenticeships
•         19-23 Apprenticeships
•         Traineeships
•         Skills for Life
•         Pre-employment training
•         Community Learning
•         ESOL
•         Skills support for the unemployed
Or they are Candidates which passed delivery of Information, advice and guidance

Title: FWK1092 - Learning and Development Framework 2 - AWARD
Description:
This notice relates to the competition to create a Learning and Development (L&D) framework. Suppliers will be expected to work with in-house L&D professionals and subject matter experts within the business to create bespoke content and to participate in pilots. All methods of delivery will be considered and the ability to provide a variety of approaches would be preferred. 

The activities covered in the Lots below may be some of the many development activities organised by the Houses of Parliament in order to support and achieve the goals set out in both Corporate Business Plans. The intention is that these activities will be ready for delivery as soon as possible after the framework has been agreed. 

Although activities will take place throughout the calendar year, they must fit with the pressures of parliamentary business.  There is likely to be less demand during periods of parliamentary recess. 

Length and timing of activities can vary but will be affected by the needs of the business. Most should be run in core business hours (0900 –1730). Most courses will run with a maximum of 12 delegates.  There will be some instances where we may need to run events outside of these hours due to the shift patterns worked by some of our staff. 
Events will normally take place on the Parliamentary Estate.  Suppliers will be expected to travel within the UK as there will be a requirement to provide training for Members’ staff in their constituencies. 

The Specification of requirements is available for downloading from https://in-tendhost.co.uk/parliamentuk/. 

Division into lots: Lot 1 Programme and Project Management, Lot 2 Financial Management, Lot 3 IT Skills, Lot 4 Parliamentary Subject Specialists, Lot 5 Parliamentary Security Staff 

Location: London with some UK travel. 
The Contract Form to be used is the Authority’s General Terms and Conditions
